dct_title_s: Philips' library map of British South Africa
dct_description_sm: Map of South Africa showing British South Africa, Portuguese territory [Mozambique], German territory [Namibia], roads, railways and telegraph lines, railways under construction, mountain passes, proclaimed goldfields, mission stations and principal steamship routes with distances in nautical miles.
Relief shown by hachures and spot heights.
Bar scale on map given in "English Miles."
Tables at bottom showing "Steamship distances" and "Railway distances."

Inset maps: Rhodesia and British Central Africa on half of the general map. Scale 1:5 000 000. 1 in. to 80 miles -- Witwatersrand, showing railways, reefs, buildings and farm boundaries. Scale [ca. 1:183 925] -- Plan of Pretoria. Scale [ca. 1:63 360] -- Track chart showing the routes to South Africa -- Pietermaritzburg. Scale [ca. 1:24 000] -- Durban. Scale [ca. 1:24 000] -- Kimberley. Scale [ca. 1:53 645] -- Port Elizabeth. Scale [ca. 1:10 400] -- South Eastern England. Scale 1:2 500 000 -- The Cape Peninsula. Scale [ca. 1:443 520] -- Cape Town. Scale [ca. 1:10 400].
dct_rights_sm: Image courtesy University of Cape Town Libraries, Special Collections: Maps scanned under the William and Yvonne Jacobson Digital Africana Program at UCT. If you have questions, please contact David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
